{"step_by_step_thinking": "Precocious puberty is the early onset of puberty, before the age of 8 in girls or 9 in boys. It can be classified into central and peripheral precocious puberty. Central precocious puberty (CPP) results from early activation of the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis. The documents mention that long-acting gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) agonists are the current therapy of choice for central precocious puberty. They have demonstrated effectiveness in halting the precocious development associated with this condition with minimal side effects. Therefore, the drug of choice for precocious puberty in girls is GnRH analogues.", "answer_choice": "A"}
